attributes.review: Great podcast supported by a vibrant community of dads who are striving to excel not only in business, but also as family men. This podcast offers a mix of interviews and discussions on critical aspects of family life, emotional intelligence, and personal health. If you are a father looking for support on how to live your best life while being a great dad, you are in the right place.
attributes.title: Excellent podcast for dads

attributes.review:
Jon is next level 
The content is dialed in
The guests are sage and choc full of shares/wisdom
If you carve out time to grow as a father, business professional and human, wedge this podcast into your flow.
attributes.title: This is the #1 podcast for family men in the grind

attributes.review: I just finished listening to episode #443 “Becoming an Eternal Optimist, Being Perfectly Imperfect and Evolving as a Parent” with Matt Drinkhahn. First off, the episode title spoke to my soul and I’ve been eagerly waiting to listen. The episode did not disappoint and I resonated with several things Matt spoke about being a perfectionist within myself that I’d like to address. This podcast is great and I’d encourage any dad (W2 or entrepreneur) who wants to better themselves to give this show a listen!
attributes.title: Great podcast for dads looking to improve themselves

attributes.review: I was introduced to this podcast two days ago and I’m 4 episodes in and it’s lit my fire to put my life into better perspective and prioritize more my family over work and business. I have 4 young kids and work in a demanding healthcare industry as well as in the middle of launching a business which goes live in May. It’s a busy time right now, and hearing so much great advice already from this podcast of how family comes first and then business, really motivates me to better align my life. I listened to the episode with Matt Drinkhahn and he talked about whenever he feels guilt and shame he writes in his journal, “welcome. I know I have something to learn from you.” And has a great perspective on how to manage it as a dad.
attributes.title: Podcasts lights my fire to improve as a dad

attributes.review: Really liked the information and insight they talked about in "becoming an eternal optimist" he mentioned the definition of an optimist is seeing things through a positive lens, which I had never thought of before. Overall just very good and nice thoughts and information.
attributes.title: Good information

attributes.review: Jon is a fantastic host and he talks to a wide range of guests about topics that really impact you as a man, father, husband and business owner. Even if you only aspire for one or more of these categories, you should listen to this podcast. Seriously.
attributes.title: Great podcast for guys that want to step up their parenting!

attributes.review: I’ve been a long time listener, and get incredible value out of each episode. In the recent interview with Matt Drinkhahm, Matt discussed his struggles with being a perfectionist, and not always being present in the moment with his family.  This struggle resonates with me, and I also share the same desire for adventure and connection with friends and family.
attributes.title: This podcast speaks directly to me

attributes.review: It is awesome to have found this podcast that is filled with so many great stories and experiences of people honestly and sincerely trying to do and be better people! It is nice to hear successful people be vulnerable and open about the challenges they're facing and how they are working to grow and become someone who can have an even greater and more positive impact on their family! Definitely worth following if you are or are wanting to be a more impactful member of your family!
attributes.title: Awesome find for any dad/father figure wanting to do and be better!

attributes.review: The tag line of family men with businesses, not business men with families is what initially drew me in. What I appreciate about this podcast is it focuses on real men, not social media influencers and gurus. The conversations are honest, vulnerable, and well rounded. I enjoy hearing how other men approach family life and how they incorporate their work into their life. These seem to be men living with purpose.
attributes.title: Real Men

attributes.review: One thing I learned from this episode was the idea that we need to feel less responsible for our kids reactions but more responsible for our own reactions to them. Much more powerful and controllable way of looking at situations.
attributes.title: Scream free parenting

attributes.review:
I had the pleasure of being invited on Jon’s podcast to share my journey of fatherhood as an entrepreneur and to dispel vegan myths. It was such a fantastic conversation.

What I love about Jon is that he’s curious and wants to learn new ways of being. Whether he uses it or not, he allows the space to share. Thats what I appreciated most about our conversation.

His interviews are always rock solid and the guests he brings on share a ton of value. If you’re a father, regardless if you have a business or not, you’ll find tremendous value in his work. I highly recommend listening to his podcast during your daily commutes, walks, or however else you like to consume them!
attributes.title: Jon is awesome!

attributes.review: Was recommended this podcast a year ago and love it. Each episode is with a fellow dad committed to be best at it. They are willing to come on and share what they have learned on their journey. I found scrolling through back episode titles I found some absolute gems of episodes that were highly relevant to me.
attributes.title: Recommend this to anybody wanting to be a great dad

attributes.review: Jon is one of the best coaches I’ve ever encountered. I first “met” him through his book, The Front Row Factor, and underlined something on every page. I was fortunate enough to hear him speak at an event, and I got the chance to get to know him. I could tell that his advice would change my life for the better, and it has. I love this podcast. It’s my #1 favorite podcast, because it focuses on what I care about most, being the best husband and father I can be. And by doing that, I’ve found I’m becoming the best human I can be. Thank you Jon for your mission and your passion.
attributes.title: You’ll be a better Human

attributes.review: I asked a friend for dad pods to recommend to my husband when we found out we’d be welcoming a son, and I think I’ve wound up enjoying Front Row Dads as much as he has! Jon is consistently having the conversations that count about fatherhood, business, and life at large. If you’re a dad, it’s a must!
attributes.title: The best! 🏆

attributes.review: This fatherhood podcast is earns a well-deserved 5 stars! Jon navigates the journey of fatherhood with insightful and genuine conversations, which offer a wealth of wisdom. From practical parenting tips to touching personal stories, it's an invaluable resource for any dad out there. In one word: this podcast is SOLID.
attributes.title: Solid Pod

attributes.review: I was recently introduced to Front Row Dads by a friend and fellow father and I’m grateful he did. To hear the perspective, philosophy, vulnerability, advice, wins, losses, improvements, spirituality, etc from other dads who are entrepreneurs brings so much value to the listeners to be a better dad, individual, community member, and business person. Family is something sacred and needs to be protected especially in our current times where it’s easy to get distracted and pulled away from the hustle and bustle of every day life. Business always took the driver seat while everything else went to the wayside. This podcast has helped bring back focus to what’s important that is being a dad that makes time  my kids no matter how busy life is, a husband that is a present and is lifelong companion to his wife, and a contributing member to society. This is a podcast is a must listen for all dads.
attributes.title: Reprioritizing Life as a Dad

attributes.review: Love the show and the genuine guests Jon always has on. If you are a Dad or just want to be a better husband and leader you need to check this out
attributes.title: Need this in my life

attributes.review: I adore Jon and the FRD podcast! Jon is masterful at facilitating impactful, intriguing, heart-centered conversations about so many topics that are relevant to both men and women. I love hearing the male perspective and have learned so much about parenting, health, finances, and business. Can’t wait until there is a Front Row Moms group.
attributes.title: Incredible podcast! Not just for men!

attributes.review: Jon is raising the bar in terms of content for men on the internet. I’m challenged and encouraged every time I listen to this podcast. Keep it up!
attributes.title: Setting the bar high

attributes.review: I’ve been listening for a long time and haven’t left a review. However, after just finishing the Hal Elrod and Mikki Willis interview I felt moved to commend this podcast with a 5 star review. During this interview the listener truly went on a journey of discovery about Mikki and his own insights and growth gave way to my own introspection - especially about parenting. I appreciate both the honesty and the transparency in this courageous conversation and I hope he will be back again! Thanks to Hal Elrod for his inquisitive and always friendly interview style. I appreciated the sharing of his own moments in parenting and the genuine curiosity that took place in this interview.
attributes.title: Courageous Conversations

attributes.review: When I first found this podcast years ago, I was immediately drawn to it because Jon felt so genuine, and the show didn’t have a hokey intro like many of the other ‘dad’casts.  There are so many good nuggets of wisdom tucked in these episodes that focus on the whole of being a dad.  If you only listen to one episode, make it the one with Jim Schiels on the Family Board Meeting.  Then you’ll want to listen to the rest.  Jon’s curiosity and drive towards putting his family first makes this one I keep coming back to!
attributes.title: Incredible value and interesting conversations

attributes.review: This is the one podcast that I listen to every new episode without fail. It is also the podcast that I share the most episodes from.
attributes.title: I don’t miss an episode

attributes.review: As an entrepreneur and father it’s hard to find a group of men that care about being the best at both. The FRD podcast opened the possibilities for how I can be a great business man but more importantly a great father. Highly recommend!
attributes.title: Great show for dads with businesses

attributes.review: I happened across the podcast about two years ago. The line “Family man with a business, not a business man with a family” has stuck in my head from that first episode. I believe being a parent is one of the most important roles I’ll play in life. Any chance I can hear from people and ideas that will help me show up as the best version of myself for my kids is a win! Listening to this podcast is an investment of my time and into my future better self.
attributes.title: Level up as a Dad!

attributes.review: This podcast is exactly what I needed at the right time. Learning how to show up better for my family has made a profound change in our lives and I am grateful for the wisdom that is found not only in the podcast but from the FRD community.
attributes.title: Deep Valuable Conversations

attributes.review: This podcast has in no small way changed my life. Every episode gives me something to level up with as a man, a husband, and a father. I am grateful for all the good you’re putting into the world.
attributes.title: Necessary Authenticity

attributes.review: No other podcast has such fresh and deep content about everything related to being a beast of a Dad. creative health, business that frees your time, and so much more.
attributes.title: Cutting edge - cuts deep

attributes.review: Such a great podcast. There is nothing more powerful than the intentional dad/husband. Knowing there is a community committed to that first and foremost has been a game changer for me.
attributes.title: Raw and authentic

attributes.review: Thoroughly enjoyed the conversation with Chad Willardson. It was my introduction to both of you guys, and I’ll be coming back for more. Jon does a great job of asking good questions and getting out of the way. And Chad has a humble, secure vibe that makes me want to listen to what he has to say.
attributes.title: I’ll be coming back for more!

attributes.review: I love listening to this show not because I’m a dad or a parent, of which I’m neither. I enjoy this show because of who Jon is, who his guests are and what this show represents. The world needs more passionate dads leading in the entrepreneurial space. Thank you Jon for everything you do.
attributes.title: The BEST show!!!

attributes.review: Every father should listen to the show. Jon is an incredible person that really cares and wants to make a family better.  As a father we should constantly be striving to be better and I hope we do. Thank you for all of the great advice and lessons we get out of this podcast.
attributes.title: Every Dad needs this

attributes.review: This is becoming my number one source to come to when having conflict in my family. The way Jon carries himself and speaks just helps you melt your ego away and ground yourself in truth and love. I could keep going on but the best thing I could say is just jump into a show and you won’t regret it. Thanks Jon, his guests and everyone behind the scenes that make this possible.
attributes.title: Grounded

attributes.review: Listening to Jon and Chad Willardson converse led me to think about my role as a father. It helped me realize the areas that I can improve. They also did it in a way that motivated me vs telling about all their achievements to distract or to intimidate. Any father looking to improve needs to listen to this episode and this show. Love this and will be listening to more of this podcast. Thank you Jon!
attributes.title: Phenomenal!!

attributes.review: I wasn’t familiar with this show until I came across Chad as a guest. What a cool pod! Jon asks poignant questions and I really like the ideas presented as successful business men lead successful families first. Chad shares many meaningful ideas that inspired me as a young father and husband to be better both in my home and in business. Highly recommend and look forward to listening to many others.
attributes.title: Episode with Chad Willardson

attributes.review: Came across your podcast when searching for Chad Willardson. Terrific interview! Taking a deep dive through your content and it’s excellent stuff for ALL Men,Fathers & Husbands. Continued success
attributes.title: Great find!

attributes.review: Front Row Dads Podcast is full of great interviews with exemplary individuals. I was really excited to hear Chad Willardson interviewed and it did not disappoint! I came away from the episode motivated to be a better father and husband. Chad had some very practical ideas about how to show up better for my family, how to teach my children about money, and how to teach my children about service. I got the sense that Chad lives what he teaches and his enthusiasm for growth/improvement is powerful. I highly recommend this podcast and the interview with Chad Willardson.
attributes.title: Episode 364 - Chad Willardson - Fanstastic interview!

attributes.review: These guys nail it with their content! I’ve started listening just recently but I’m hooked! As I work my way through the past episodes and anticipate future episodes, I’m loving all I’m hearing and learning and how I’m growing in my thoughts about being a better dad.
attributes.title: Great content!

attributes.review: I told by wife the other day that I was going to join FRD because it literally feeds my soul. Every aspect of what this group is about aligns with who I want to be. Cant wait to become a member when enrollment opens up!
attributes.title: Best podcast hands down

attributes.review: Heard the episode with Kelly, and look forward to listening to the book 🔥💯 Thank you for adding this value to the world!
attributes.title: 3 episodes in and already got value!

attributes.review: I love everything about this podcast- especially the message! Always has Great content! Check out episode #356 Doctor Kelly Flanagan is 🔥🔥🔥
attributes.title: Top notch

attributes.review: I absolutely love the wisdom shared by fellow dads on this show. These stories are authentic, insightful, and powerful. As someone who’s working to become the best dad and husband I can be, this podcast is a must listen for me because I’m always showing up better in my personal life on days I listen to it.
attributes.title: Required listening for the modern Father

attributes.review: I am newer to this podcast and literally in the first episode I listened to I already gained practical and easy to apply tools to dramatically change my conversations with my wife and kids. Game changer!  This is not fluff or feel good inspiration. This is the real work of living your intention and becoming the man you always envisioned yourself to be.  Jon’s show is now part of my daily and weekly learning!  (Check out the episode with Nathanael Chawkin for sure.)
attributes.title: Do NOT miss as a dad, husband and business leader!

attributes.review: It seems that no matter who John is interviewing, he does so with tons of energy, a positive attitude, and a true interest in uncovering the path each person has taken to get to where they are at on their journey. Jon is also open about his own journey, and it’s interesting to listen to his interviews morph (over time) as he up levels and grows himself.
attributes.title: Integrity at depth with a side of vulnerability

attributes.review: I love this podcast because it forces me to be mindful of putting the things first that i should. I love their tag line of family men with businesses not business men with families!
attributes.title: Awesome content for guys looking to put family first

attributes.review: I have been listening to Jon for a couple months now and the authentic message he facilitates is great.  Old episodes or new, I have been finding many ways to be a more intentional father and husband which makes me a better father and husband.  Have joined the FRD community and can’t wait to be more involved with these men.
attributes.title: A community worth being a part of

attributes.review: Awesome podcast and community! John’s passion and energy can be felt with each interview. Its rare to find people like John who pour everything they have into others. This is my top podcast! I listen to each week!
attributes.title: A must listen for all Dads!

attributes.review:
Hearing Stephen speak on the Front Row Dads podcast resonated with me. As a young father and business owner, I’ve been seeking to find balance and presence in my life, while also aiming to exit my business so I can spend my time how I want to. 

I’ve realized that mentorship and connection is vital in realizing my aspirations and to that end continuing to learn from this show is very helpful.
attributes.title: On point

attributes.review: This podcast provides insightful and actionable advice. I love learning from Jon and his guests. The conversations go deep, on wide ranging topics. Highly recommend!
attributes.title: Amazing Resource for Dads

attributes.review: This podcast gives me the clarity and confidence I have been seeking on what I do well and where I can improve in my roles as a husband and father.
attributes.title: Clarity and Confidence

attributes.review: I listen to this podcast when I feel the urge to learn more about how to be a great father and husband, while enjoying life to the fullest, and doing work that I love.
attributes.title: Awesome Podcast for Dads!

attributes.review: Forward deep thinking podcasts that helps us realize the impact we have on everyone in our lives.
attributes.title: So positive

attributes.review:
A friend recommended this podcast to me about 2 months ago and I have been listening to this show as much as I can. 

This show is reminding me to be present and make decisions with intension when dealing with the family. It is heartfelt and funny all at the same time. Im looking forward to joining the brotherhood
attributes.title: Best podcast

attributes.review:
I enjoyed this terrific discussion with Michael Port who shared thoughts on a wide range of topics. I particularly liked his ideas about having weekly money and budget talks with his wife, the rich versus wealthy approach, and the ways they help their children learn to live within their means (his family uses an app), and avoid dicey financial schemes.
An interesting, fun interview with a passionate, successful entrepreneur sharing valuable insights.
attributes.title: Ep 329 w/Michael Port - Well Worth My Time

attributes.review:
Great Discussion! Some key takeaways:
1. Reinvesting 100% is often not best plan for you
2. Y R U not budgeting!?, cmon man! Use an app, get r done.
3. Rich (spends their $); Wealthy-Manages it
4. Teach teen kids; they get a budget w/veto authority, etc...
5. Budget together as a couple; make it real, make it fun

Thanks!
Rosario
attributes.title: Ep 329 W/Michael Port - Excellent

attributes.review: Episode 325 with Alan Stein is a must listen for anyone involved in any capacity with youth sports -Fan, Coach, ref, etc.  The concept of “next play” and tips for how to approach your kid after a win or loss are timeless reminders.  Strong recommend.
attributes.title: Episode 325 - A must listen for any one involved in youth sports!

attributes.review:
I found this podcast about 2 years ago and have loved every episode of it along the way. The guests are always very interesting people and the perspectives that are shared really help to make you feel connected to the stories. 

I loved listening to the One Word Family (ep. 312) with Seth Dailey and immediately came home and told my wife we have to start implementing this! We’re going to introduce this to the kids and a few friends’ families and have a painting party where everyone can paint their One Word!
attributes.title: Love this Podcast as a Father, Husband and Friend!

attributes.review:
This podcast is incredibly inspiring and helps me be a better Dad to my two children.  I love the sense of community and warmth captured in each broadcast. Keep ‘em coming!  

Ed Sexton
attributes.title: Addicted to this content

attributes.review:
I have been a long-time listener of front row dads, and I have found a wealth of practical advice with each show your team provides. 

I am a brand new dad, and started listening in the lead-up to my our plans to conceive. I feel that having this show has given me a huge head start, and I am truly grateful! 

Guests like your most recent Uncle Fred are the reason I keep listening. I heard from you initially by the SPI podcast and have kept on since!

Thanks!
attributes.title: Being Bold With Uncle Fred

attributes.review:
It’s so refreshing to find other guys that want to excel as a father and a husband. 

Being intentional is hard but worth it. Jon and the guests he has on Front Row Dads take this calling seriously. 

If you’re unsure about your purpose, your path, or your purpose, do yourself a favor and listen o Front Row Dads, take notes as needed, and then act on these good bits of wisdom. 

Thanks for being here for us dudes, Jon!
attributes.title: Just What Every Dad Needs!

attributes.review: I keep coming back to the Front Row Dads podcast because Jon Vroman keeps bringing amazing content and amazing people—there are stories from dads ‘in the trenches” and there are also great experts in the areas of life that matter to me -from health and wealth to marriage and raising awesome kids.  Being a dad is hard sometimes!  And it makes a big difference to find a tribe of supportive men to travel with on the journey.  I find so many of those men inside of this podcast!
attributes.title: My Go to Resource for being a better dad

attributes.review: Jon really dives deep into the challenges of being a parent in this modern age, and has guests that really bring value and insight, some of it counterintuitive, to any dad (or mom) who wants to put being a parent first in their lives. Positive, in depth info for everyone!
attributes.title: Solid guidance and insight for any parent

attributes.review: I love all the Front Row Dad podcasts. Episode 312 inspired me. I like the idea of having one word for the year. Something that the whole family can strive for. Great Episode
attributes.title: One Word

attributes.review: The episode where Mike Miller is interviewed is full of spot on ideas on how to make financial education more deliberate at home. I’m looking forward to reading Mike’s book “First Habits Win”. This podcast just keeps delivering excellent episodes!
attributes.title: Deliberate financial education at home!

attributes.review: Jon, host of the Front Row Dads podcast, highlights all aspects of life, parenting and more in this can’t miss podcast!  The host and expert guests offer insightful advice and information that is helpful to anyone that listens!
attributes.title: Awesome podcast!

attributes.review: I listen to every episode. Jon is real. I like his approach and appreciate the content. Keep it up.
attributes.title: Love it!

attributes.review: Listening to Jon talk about his family, kids, and experience as a father is as casual as talking to my best friend about our experiences. There is so much to take away from every episode. I really enjoyed the one with Krister Ungerbock about how we talk to our kids and why it matters more than we think (episode 279 I think). But it’s so much more than just our kids: it’s how we talk to our friends, spouse, co-workers and everyone in between. I really appreciate the powerful content that Jon packs into his podcast
attributes.title: Powerful content

attributes.review: I've been listening to this podcast for awhile and many episodes have been incredibly impactful. I'll pick 3 that have really stuck with me. The episode with Jesse Harless offered an amazing reframe for addiction and the how the stigma of the word prevents us from acknowledging what addictions we have. The fresh definition also allowed me to identify actions I need to work on and addictions I need to manage better. I also really enjoyed trying cold showers. He gave me that push to give it a shot. The episode with Nate Klemp was great as well. As my fianceé and I build our relationship and marriage the concept of fairness and balance just naturally come up as a part of typical relationship culture. His 80-80 concert really opened my eyes to new possibilities and potentials about how we both create a relationship that provides space for us to each thrive as individuals as well as a couple. That framework will be pivotal moving forward. Lastly the episode with Krister Ungerböck was great. Not only does he talk about the importance of language and how it impacts all areas of our lives via relationships, but he includes training and actions to move into better and more effective directions with language. The learning and information behind the shifts are also fascinating. As I progress personally and professionally implementing these shifts can enrich my success and fulfillment in either. Incredible tools to build strong relationships through speech. Thanks for creating a podcast around being a great man - at home, at work, at fatherhood, at life. It helps me align with my purpose and growth.
attributes.title: My favorite 3 episodes

attributes.review: I liked the episode featuring Krister as well, but a turning point for me was hearing your words at just about the 9-minute mark of the Nate Klemp episode: ".. so much of my pain has been because I bring the energy, that I then get back, and don't like." Straight to the heart. The pandemic has been tough for all of us, but it's been changing the energy I have, and I need to remember that they mirror what they see, and I need to model what I want them to model. Thanks for the conversation with Nate Klemp, and hey Jon - Go Birds!
attributes.title: Jon is having some life-changing conversations

attributes.review: This Podcast is a must listen to anyone that is trying to become a better father and/or husband. Jon is one of the best interviewers I have heard and bring a diverse background of guest to offer valuable insight to the listener. I am relatively new to Front Row Dads, but I’m very excited to make my way through many more of his past and future podcast. Jon truly cares about people and it’s very obvious with the quality of information he puts on there. Thank you Jon!
attributes.title: Highly recommend this podcast

attributes.review: Another awesome episode of FRD. The idea of taking out “you” from tense conversations really resonated with me. I feel my child understands me better when I replace it with “we” and thinks that “we are in this together” and there is nothing that we can’t do to fix the issue. Thanks and rock on FRD!
attributes.title: Insightful conversation with Krister Ungerböck

attributes.review:
I’ve really enjoyed many of the conversations had thus far on the show. But the episode highlighting the anti vaccine guest was a huge disappointment. I am open minded, and in that light, I was encouraged to go research many of the the claims made (you have not led me astray so far)! But I quickly realize many of these “facts” are either flat out false or have been disproven.

I agree deeply with the first amendment, and believe you have a right to post this podcast. But for me to be a listener (or sign up for the brotherhood), you also have a responsibility to not raise up folks making baseless, exaggerated, or other similar claims without at least attempting to have a discussion on the other end. 

Best.
attributes.title: Bummer

attributes.review: Really loved the concept, I learned a lot from the diverse perspectives from others on the show, and I was considering joining the brotherhood. But I’m done with it after the Christian Elliot episode. His very eloquent “18 Reasons Why I’m Not Getting the Vaccine” has become viral anti-vaxxer  fodder. His article was not courageous - it was filled with tired anti-vaxxer arguments and trivializes the millions of people the virus has killed. I’m a physician who has had to isolate from his children, watch patients and relatives die from the disease, watch my fellow doctors and nurses get sick, and I still can’t convince a lot of my patients to get vaccinated because they read garbage like this. Meanwhile, my relatives in Taiwan are desperate for vaccine donations to protect them from the recent surge; his writing feels like a slap in the face in to them. Courage is the people who volunteered for the clinical vaccine trials (with full informed consent btw), not people like Elliot. Jon Vroman celebrating him on this podcast crossed the line for me; I want nothing to do with the brotherhood now. Unfollowing.
attributes.title: Really enjoyed until an anti-vaxxer was honored for his courage

attributes.review: I enjoyed hearing from Krister and his experiences that led him to write his book. It was an authentic conversation that we were able to listen in on.
attributes.title: Great listen

attributes.review: Just finished listening to Kristen Ungerbock discuss HOW you speak to your kids. Very moving, actionable and practical suggestions that will improve communication and ultimately the relationship between parents and kids. The SOONER this is read and implemented the better !!
attributes.title: OUTSTANDING- HOW you speak to your kids

attributes.review: Best podcast I’ve ever listened to. Super relevant to any family man looking for inspiration and tips to up their dad game. Thank you JV for all the work you put into these shows!
attributes.title: So good!

attributes.review: Front Row Dads is a must listen podcast for men.  It covers a variety of topics that are important  men at many different stages of their lives and provides much needed real information and advice.
attributes.title: Must Listen

attributes.review: Front Row Dads is a great podcast that challenges you on real life issues and calls you to a higher level of being a man, a father and husband. Jon has done a great job of developing a community of men that encourages and strengthens me. I just finished listening to the episode with Nate Klemp. Looking forward to reading his book 80/80 marriage.
attributes.title: Great podcast!

attributes.review: I just discovered Jon Vroman due to receiving Hal Elrod’s (The Miracle Morning) emails and being a part of their masterclass.  Talk about being in the right place at the right time.  I need to make changes to improve my relationship with my kids and my wife, and his knowledge is helping get on the right path.   The latest podcast with Nate Klemp is a must-listen for any married man.
attributes.title: Outstanding, I needed this knowledge in my life

attributes.review: This podcast and community is an absolute game changer and what every man needs! As a former US Army Special Operator, I used to believe I was “all that is man” but I quickly realized that the true test of manhood was how well I showed up each day for my wife and two amazing children! Episode 270 with John Eldredge was enlightening and encouraged me to re-evaluate “success” by how much I can show and express Love and Validation for my children everyday!
attributes.title: Love & Validation

attributes.review: I just listen to the podcast with Jesse talking about addictions. Brings to light addictions in our lives that are overlooked because they are considered “addictions”. Like my addiction of being in control of my family with my children with my wife. Definitely wanna get my hands on that book.
attributes.title: Crazy addictions

attributes.review: The episode with Jesse is amazing! I’m currently in grad school to become a mental health counselor and what was discussed in this episode is seen on a daily basis in our clinic. Oh and by the way, EVERYONE is an addict so EVERYONE should listen to this episode. Thanks fellas for the hard work!
attributes.title: Addiction episode spot on!

attributes.review: I just finished listening to podcast 273 where there was a conversation with Jesse Halress. I really like the recognition that was brought up with addiction and recovery. This episode resonated with me personally. I faced a drinking problem a year ago and have now found battles with food (probably as a substitute). I have never really discussed my previous issues with my boys, but feel they need to be aware of addiction signs and consequences. As Jon states, my name I’ve and I can see the clear behavior changes in the boys when they spend too much time on electronics. I am going to take the ideas from this podcast to talk to the kids, on their level, about addiction. It needs to be recognized on all levels and not just affiliated with alcohol and drugs! I think mental health is quickly becoming more of an issue and will be more of a problem in the coming years with the blow back of COVID. Thanks Jon for the great podcasts!
attributes.title: Great Awareness

attributes.review: Wow!  Great listening two men who are living wild at heart.  An honest conversation about life, love, and being present.  John Eldredge thank you for your passion for helping people learn about God and real man stuff.  Blessings to you both, thank you!!  This is my first listen, of many, of the Front Row Dads podcast.
attributes.title: Wild at Heart

attributes.review: Just discovered this podcast about a week ago and it’s gold! I make sure to listen to at least one episode a day. Loved episode 271 with Craig Kessler, my wife and I love top golf and it was great to hear someone from a large popular company share their wisdom. Keep them comming!
attributes.title: Ep. 271

attributes.review:
Discovered this podcast and listened episode 270 at exactly the time I needed it most.   Over the course of this past year my 13 year old son and I have become strangers to each other and I’ve been mourning the loss of deep connection and enjoyment we once had of each other.  Yesterday I told him we were shutting off our phones until tomorrow and putting them in a drawer.   We headed to a local park by the beach with a variety of sports equipment, food, blankets, and lanterns.
We got home around 9pm and the next day he asked if we could do that once a week.  The connection we had again left me in such a great mood that some people thought I had lost weight or changed my look somehow.  Nope!  It was simply the joy on my face and the love for my son and the gratitude I have for getting to be a DAD!
attributes.title: Thank You John Eldredge and John Vroman for Inspiring Me to Become the Dad my son still needs!

attributes.review: Great podcast.  Just what I needed.  Keep them coming!    The idea to go on adventures w kids was timely for me.
attributes.title: Level up Dad

attributes.review: I was recommended this podcast by a friend and was lucky enough to hear the latest episode with Craig Kessler.  What an amazing idea to continue to compile advice from dad’s with all different backgrounds.  This podcast is great because it continues to remind me to stay on top of my game with my family amidst all of the external pressures going on in my life.  What is also great is John’s humility to admit that he still stumbles and makes mistakes right there along with us.  That is what makes this podcast so relatable.  Keep it up!
attributes.title: One of my new favorite podcasts

attributes.review: Loved the latest episode with Craig Kessler. My kids are older but I defintely got some great nuggets from hearing his experiences. Can't wait to read his book. FYI - the park in NJ Craig and Jon were talking about is Clementon Park & Splash World. The park was actually put up for auction in April but was purchased and is reopening soon under a new owner.
attributes.title: Great episode!

attributes.review: I diligently listen to every podcast episode and always find a surprise nuget of wisdom from every guest Jon invites. The latest episode with Craig Kessler is one of my favorites. He has an upcoming book that I'm looking forward to reading. If you are a Dad willing to learn from others and improve, I highly recommend Front Row Dads!
attributes.title: Engaged Dads

attributes.review: Loved the most recent podcast with Craig Kessler! Such great advices from both Jon and Craig! Thank you guys for serving us with your wisdom, experiences, and advice.
attributes.title: What I need as a father/partner!

attributes.review: Stumbled upon this podcast on my walk to work and had the opportunity to check out the episode with John Eldredge.  As the father of two young boys, I'm always looking for voices that focus on heart, service of others, and adventure.  This episode ticked all the boxes, looking forward to exploring the rest of the Front Row Dads catalogue!
attributes.title: Great find!

attributes.review: Amazing podcast for busy dads looking to improve their impact on their families. Learned a ton from Craig Kessler’s new project. Love the vision and values of Front Row Dads!
attributes.title: One of my favorites!

attributes.review: Was referred from a friend who knows these guys and was hooked after the first episode. I’ve been a fan of creating buckets of success as I don’t measure success solely on wealth creation. My focus in no particular order is career, family, friendship, personal development and adventure. These guys have the same focus and was super cool to hear Jon quit drinking a few years ago as I had a similar story.
attributes.title: These guys have their priorities straight

attributes.review: This podcast has great speakers with excellent advice on how to improve as a husband and father. Just starting my entrepreneurial journey, I plan to implement some of these strategies to keep my priorities in order and make sure my family is a higher priority than my business.
attributes.title: Awesome!

attributes.review:
I’ve been listening to Front Row Dads for a little while now and I am always impressed by the way they advocate prioritizing their families. I was especially encouraged to hear their vulnerability in this episode and comforted there are other guys like me in this group. 

Powerful takeaway from Dr. Danny “Are we running on the neurochemistry of love and creativity, or of fear and reactivity?”

Strongly considering joining the brotherhood!!
attributes.title: Tremendous Insights!

attributes.review:
Front Row Dad’s is a great resource for any dad, grandad, or anyone who want to improve their relationship which there children and help them grow healthier and happier. I particularly enjoyed episode 262: How to Play Off Your Partner’s Strengths. It a great episode because the resources describe how to objectively evaluate ourselves to learner our strengths and how that works with our partners strengths.
I have listened to the FRD podcast for over a year. I enjoy the variety of topics and particularly appreciate the absence of “toxic masculinity” that other father oriented podcast occasionally have.
attributes.title: Front Row Dads: great resource for anyone who want to improve involvement in a child’s life

attributes.review: I was completely onboard with their friend group until I was told I had to be pet of the Facebook group (which I don’t use) and had to pay $850 a year just to be in clique. Otherwise I generally enjoy the content provided here.
attributes.title: Good podcast

attributes.review:
Great podcast. I am a dad to 6 amazing kids and realize that no matter how much I know there is much to learn. Being able to listen to experts in a variety of fields and men who just want to make us better dads is so helpful. 

Often it seems the culture at large wants different things than we do as dads so having intentionality around leading our children is needed. Finding good information to help in that really makes a difference. That’s where Front Row Dads comes in. 

Thank you for the great resources and keep it up please.
attributes.title: Great support for dads

attributes.review: Two and a half years since starting my own business, I’m so lucky to have come across this podcast. There truly is a niche for everything now. I’m a Dad who wants to be the best Dad possible, but my life may not always look that way. This show is so uplifting and practical. I cannot wait to listen to the whole archive!
attributes.title: Just What I Needed! I’m hooked!

attributes.review:
I’m so glad I’ve found Front Row Dads! It matches and expresses the values I want to embody as a father and entrepreneur. The episode with Justin Donald about financial freedom and lifestyle investing is going help my wife and I make better decisions in the future. I can’t wait to join the brotherhood! 
-Tom
attributes.title: Exactly what I’ve been looking for!

attributes.review: I started listening to FRD’s about a year ago when my wife was pregnant with our first child. Listening in on these conversations have been invaluable in my life in the short time I’ve been listing. I just finished the episode with Dr. Kelly and feel so motivated to jump focus on deepening my connection with my wife as we are in the midst of being new parents. I fully intend to become a member of the brotherhood this year and can’t recommend this enough to every dad out there! Each episode charges me up to take it a step further as an entrepreneur and new dad - I can’t thank you all enough!
attributes.title: This may be the single greatest resource for dads

attributes.review: I am husband, father and friend Who has lost focus on connections in my relationships with building my two businesses over the past two years. I found front row dad‘s and loved the episode with Dr. Kelly. I cannot wait to start reading his book lovable and rebuilding my true self, identifying my wounds and develop a healing process game plan that I can live by and share with others. Thank you Jon and FRD podcast!
attributes.title: So glad I found FRD

attributes.review: I recently came across this podcast as I was listening to Rob Dials “Mindset Mentor” podcast. I was very impressed by Jon’s opinions, perspectives, and advice on an array of topics when he was a guest. I instantly found Jon’s podcast and subscribed. I’ve had a lot of questions/ thoughts about investing and this listen was worth every second. Great information and advice. It was great to hear about Justin Donald’s personal beliefs, experiences and mistakes with regards to building wealth. He not only talks about wealth, but the more important factors like family, personal health, and service.
attributes.title: Relevant.and.informative

attributes.review: I’ve only listened to a couple podcasts, but it is great content for a parent looking to be a healthy leader of the family. There are a few people I highly respect in the group including the Self Storage master, Mike Wagner! That indicates to me that it’s a group I would want to be in line with.
attributes.title: Great group to help take you to the next level

attributes.review: I’m a father, business owner and husband in my forties. I definitely have a bunch of areas I need to improve in my life. Front row dads has been speaking to my soul for months now. This last episode withDr Kelly Flanagan is an answer to prayers.  You are doing a great work Jon. Never has the world needed people like you more. Keep delivering!
attributes.title: Love the mission of front row Dads

attributes.review: I really enjoy this show. Dr Kelly gave me some great insights about building more friendship with myself, my wife, my family, and those around me!
attributes.title: Loved the Dr. Kelly Episode

attributes.review: Just joined the brotherhood this week!  This podcast can change your life forever!   The ability to respond instead of react has helped 100x in my decision making.  Mike Wagner explained it all on a level of understanding for real life situations, and provided a plan of action.   Can’t wait to read Dr Danny’s book!
attributes.title: Personal development gold! Amazing show!  Gets right down to actionable steps!

attributes.review: “No amount of success can make up for failure in the home”. I read this in a book recently and it inspired me to look for ways to become a better father and husband.  I was introduced to this podcast through a friend, and being a part of Mike Wagner’s Storage Rebellion group (you should check it out, it’s amazing), the Mike Wagner episode was the first episode of Front Row Dads I listened to. The information they share about Dr Danny Friedland’s book in this episode is pure gold. I can’t wait to read it and apply it to my life. I am looking forward to diving into the rest of the podcast!
attributes.title: Great Podcast

attributes.review: “Am I running on the neurochemistry of love and creativity or on the neurochemistry of fear and reactivity.” - Dr Danny Friedland
attributes.title: Pure gold! FRD ties it all together for me

attributes.review:
I’ve been listening to Front Row Dads for a few months now and I’m learning what it takes to father my two kids in a way that shows them that I love them and want the best for them in way that isn’t confused with something else. The episode with Justin Donald was excellent and  it really got me thinking.  Thanks for the great episode and interview.  

 Family First!!!
attributes.title: Learning, Growing, Becoming Better!

attributes.review:
Wow... just.. Wow. I listened to this podcast multiple time on a plane and for the first time felt “understood” as a man. Mike so eloquently and with strength and vulnerability, expressed how the male brain has been conditioned to think and protect (reptilian brain) and how we are evolving, and need to continue to learn how to transition to our “thinking” brain. I was truly moved. How to transition to reading and knowing this information and getting it to our hearts was a game changer for me. Thank you Michael for your strength and making the call out for us to keep the conversations flowing. Thank you Jon Vroman for the platform that makes these conversations possible. For years I’ve not know what to do with these thoughts or who could relate. Now I know. I feel so at home at FRD.

Vereb
attributes.title: Thank you Michael Wagner !!!!

attributes.review: I have been listening to Front Row Dads podcast for a while now. The last episode with Justin Donald was especially helpful if you want to learn about investing. This is a great podcast even if you aren’t a father.
attributes.title: Great podcast from some Great people

attributes.review: I’ve been following the FRD podcast for years now and always enjoy and find value in Jon’s podcast. His most recent podcast with Justin Donald was definitely a favorite! Justin’s investment advice is sure to pay dividends to anyone who listens and Jon’s advice and that of his guests will always help you become a better person and a better dad. I know that I’m a better husband, father, and person because of Jon and I encourage anyone who wants the same in their life to listen to the FRD podcast!
attributes.title: FRD is Invaluable

attributes.review: If you want to be the best Dad and husband possible, come join Jon and guests to learn about balancing the different pieces of your life and generally upgrading from where you are now. Get encouragement, inspiration and tactical advice.
attributes.title: Get help being your best self

attributes.review: I’ve been a successful investment advisor serving high net worth clients for 36 years.  Justin’s advice about creating passive income is worthy of your attention and makes him a modern day Robert Kiyosaki (Rich Dad Poor Dad).
attributes.title: Justin Donald’s Investing Advice Deserves Your Attention

attributes.review: Recently found this podcast and have thoroughly enjoyed the few episodes I’ve listened to. Jon is authentic and brings on high-level guests that provide value in varying ways. Appreciated being introduced to his most recent guest, Justin Donald, who teases multiple investment opportunities.
attributes.title: Authentic

attributes.review: Not only will this podcast help you become a better father but it will help you become better in every area of your life. I love the genuineness and authenticity Jon and each of his guests bring on every episode!
attributes.title: Amazing podcast!

attributes.review: Jon is one of the best interviewers and he's super authentic.  There are gems in every episode.  I would highly recommend this podcast to anyone that is looking to be a better dad or husband.  This podcast and group of men have helped me improve my life in so many ways.  I'm super grateful that I found Front Row Dads!
attributes.title: Excellent Podcast & Group

attributes.review: This podcast is one of the best personal development podcast available.  EVEN if you’re not a dad.  This is gold!!!!!
attributes.title: This is gold

attributes.review: Amazing interviewer! Great guests!! Real talk. No bs. No sugar coating. Raw, real, and great content!!
attributes.title: Jon is the man!

attributes.review:
Listened to the episode “Why Kids Need Biodiversity”. Great intro and podcast voice! Super professional! Easy to listen to for sure. In this episode, we are joined by Zach Bush who has a lot of great things to say about getting kids outside.

I agree that kids today are being so sterilized in this war on germs. I love that he talks about “bringing Mother Earth into the nuclear family”. Having them be engaged in Mother Nature. I also agree that more war is not the solution and leads to more death.

This episode is a serious one and asks bold questions. It makes me wonder where our future is headed if we do not get real about change. Thank you for being unafraid to publish this content that says what others are avoiding. I am not a Dad yet but I still got value.

I like that your episodes vary in length. I enjoy listening to long episodes but also the occasional bite sized episode. These are things that people need to hear. It may not be easy but it is necessary. I recommend this to anyone who is a Dad or just values their family’s future.
attributes.title: Great for Dads and Dudes alike!

attributes.review: Jon, we appreciate all of the amazing content you put together. The only problem I have with it is that you have too many take-always, a great problem to have! An abundance of great info and ideas. Thank you Jon!
attributes.title: Jon’s Podcast is full of take-always:)

attributes.review: If there is a decline in the quality of fatherhood in our world, Front Row Dads is part of the solution. So good!
attributes.title: Remarkably intentional and authentic!

attributes.review: We all need help, support and resources.  I have found the FRD podcast (and The Brotherhood) to be what I’ve needed for a long time.  I’m so thankful for Jon and all of the work he has done for us!
attributes.title: Be a better Father... WORK AT IT!

attributes.review: When I first spoke with Jon, I could tell how much he cared about life beyond work. He put family first yet still was able to balance it all together and shared why he cared so much. I don’t remember what else we discussed but I remember the feeling her left me with when we were done. His podcasts reflects those same feelings as you gain a lot of wisdom and insight into Jon’s life and the people he interviews.
attributes.title: Standing up for what’s important

attributes.review: The best podcast for dads! Jon is sharing content and information that is much needed. He is also creating a community of dads who become leaders who develop leaders within their own home.
attributes.title: Best Podcast for Dads

attributes.review: AMAZING. 💛 Jon brings the message and depth in such a way that you don’t just hear his heart, you feel it. This is evolution, this is hope— not just for guys and fathers, but for women like me who want to live that front row life too!
attributes.title: This is what we are all craving to hear

attributes.review: I'm a huge fan of what Jon is creating with Front Row dads. It's more than just the podcast. The brotherhood has been helpful to my marriage and my parenting. If you're a dad, definitely check out this podcast and also consider joining Front Row Dads.
attributes.title: Best dad podcast

attributes.review: Jon and the Front Row Dads are amazing. Having attended retreats and joined the community, I can’t say enough about this show and group, keep it up!
attributes.title: This show is amazing!

attributes.review: This podcast has fundamentally changed how I parent. My 11 year old told me just recently that he hasn’t heard me say the F word or get angry in 6 months (about how long I have been listening to the podcast). Granted, I only have him every other weekend- and I still get angry and say the F word at times. I think his comment made me realize that real change is happening and that my son has noticed my growth in emotional mastery.
attributes.title: Frontrowdad

attributes.review: What can be said about this podcast that hasn’t already been said. Jon has orchestrated his life in a manner that allows him to eat, sleep and breathe his role as husband, first and foremost, and then father. He works hard to live in the roller coaster of life with his family. There is no juggling of work life balance, it’s just life and this is reflected in his work, play, and all life. He models and brings other models of fatherhood that are exemplary in empowering us as dads to see life differently. Not driven by the typical enculturated beliefs of an American Dream built on the INDIVIDUAL pursuit of happiness but about healthy family systems that drive healthy family relationships, breeding healthy friendships and healthy life engagements in community. If Jon speaks, he speaks from deep listening and his words humbly echo the voices of wisdom he has collected over the years. Thank you Jon for empowering men with kids to fathers of leaders. Love you brother!
attributes.title: Honest and Raw to the Core

attributes.review: Such a great podcast for men who truly desire to be men and raise children who have a heart to change the world!
attributes.title: Been Following Jon for Years

attributes.review: This is one of my all time favorite podcasts. Real men being deeply transparent about what has worked AND about why they have struggled with. Jon Vroman is a master at diving deep with just the right questions. Do yourself a favor and add this one to your daily playlist!
attributes.title: The BEST Parenting & Dads Podcast

attributes.review: Here you have a group of guys learning from each other to be better Dads, husbands and more. I highly recommend this group. Join!
attributes.title: Are you a good Dad? Husband? Guy?

attributes.review: I’ve listened to several of Jon’s episodes and love how he goes deep and gets real with each person on the hopes, dreams, and fears of being a dad. Well worth the time!
attributes.title: Great resource for dads

attributes.review:
I believe this podcast has influenced me on a personal level more than any other I’ve listened to. You get sucked in to the energy of this group of men who want to be the best version of themselves for the sake of those they serve - mostly, their family. 

Family men with businesses, not businessmen with families.
attributes.title: Life changing

attributes.review:
This podcast has so much to offer. If you are looking looking for motivation, inspiration and some guidance you have come the the right place.
 This is a podcast that interviews successful men that have brought and spread their success into their families and home life. Tons of awesome strategies and tools that you can use and implement into your family/structure and routines that make it so you can really boost and enrich your family life. 
There are tips for raising kids, balancing work and even marital advice, tools and knowledge. Real top notch stuff. And Jon is an absolute treat to listen to, he has a wonderful light about him that really carries the show. 
I’ve listened to about 40 episodes thus far and I honestly feel like a better man because of it. 
So many good books and literature to help back up all of this content, wonderful guests who aren’t afraid to really dig deep for meaning and advice. 
Highly recommended
attributes.title: Wow

attributes.review: Nuggets in every episode to help men become the best fathers/husbands they can be
attributes.title: A must for any dad

attributes.review:
If you’re ready to take your marriage and your relationship with your kids to the next level, this is the show for you.

Jon is an excellent host and brings on incredible guests who are all on a mission to be the best father and man they can be.

As a small business owner, my new mantra based on my learnings from Jon and his podcast is ... “I’m a family man with a business and not a businessman with a family.”
attributes.title: Fatherhood 2.0

attributes.review: My name is Layne Bruner and I raise two self-aware boys, 12 and 9. I am also a single Mom with a small business. I loved the podcast on boys wearing coats and it hit home. Thanks for the great work and please share more on boys and body awareness and body confidence.
attributes.title: Front Row Mom!

attributes.review: As a new dad, this show has given me an immense amount of value. Not only has it shown returns in the relationships I have with my kids but also my marriage and my business. If you’re even thinking about becoming a new dad, this show is binge-worthy.
attributes.title: Insights for new dads

attributes.review: This is a must listen for every dad out there. Not only do the sessions bring quality content that is relevant, but the guests and host are genuine, full of character and integrity. Jon interviews and interacts with them in a way that is so smooth it outshines so many others attempting this out there. Yet he is transparent and humble. Guys download this stream - your life will thank you for it.
attributes.title: The secret sauce every Dad is looking for

attributes.review: Excellent podcast, nugget-bombs in every episode, it is changing my life. I’ve been searching for dads like this for the past 5 years. Men of character and success at home and work, 100% recommend.
attributes.title: Every father should hear this
Front Row Dads is a Game Changer

attributes.review:
The penguin. So simple. Break the pattern. I buy into this concept - break the pattern. Just didn’t know how to best do it. Loved the simplicity in this episode. Did this with my daughter as she started to “rumble” and it completely diffused the situation. Another tool for the tool box. Thanks!

-Evan Keller
attributes.title: Arel Moodie

attributes.review: Love the latest episode featuring Nir Eyal on becoming indestractable at home. Big takeaway was when Nir said “The antidote to impulsiveness is forethought.”  He shared some great strategies & tools to plan ahead for traction & master external triggers that so often distract us from what’s important. I’m excited to try out some new ideas to time box & be more intentional with my time & what’s important.
attributes.title: Amazing resource to strategies to become a better parent!

attributes.review: This is great podcast for dads trying to balance family with business ventures. It's a great community of dads with great advice for making it work.
attributes.title: These Dads Mean Business!

attributes.review: I enjoy listening to the lessons learned from the guest’s experiences and there are plenty of tips and ideas to try out or reflect on. This is a great resource if you want to become a better dad!
attributes.title: A Community for Motivated Dads

attributes.review: Extremely informative and inspirational podcast with actionable steps for fathers, who wish to become a better family man.  One of my favorite takeaways has been the implementation of board meetings with my 6 year old daughter.  We’ve done 2 board meetings thus far and are due for a third very soon.  We absolutely loves them and I cherish the intentional quality time spent with her.  My marriage has also seen improvement as a result of this podcast.  My wife and I have implemented “couple talk time” twice a week, where we catch up on the past couple days, as well as, game plan our lives both near term and long term.  Needless to say, I am so thrilled to have come across Jon Vroman and his wonderful podcast.  I can’t thank you enough for all your help and look forward to continually improve as a father, a husband and a man!
attributes.title: Life Changing & Inspirational

attributes.review: Jon Vroman does a great job with this show. From selecting guests to the interviewing to his overall execution of the show it is absolutely great. I learn something new to try every episode and can’t wait for the next episode to get released. Overall super helpful insights and just a great guy to learn from. Keep up the good work Jon and hope to meet you someday.
attributes.title: One of the guiding lights in my quest to be a better family man.

attributes.review: This podcast and group is fantastic! The topics are very diverse and cover all bases. The speakers are all very knowledgeable and come from a great place. The host, Jon Vroman, has a great ability to make the podcast fun and personal every time!
attributes.title: Outstanding resource for all Fathers!

attributes.review: As a dedicated husband and father of twin toddlers life can feel heavy. FRD’s has been a true guide to being who I need to be now for my wife and kids as well as giving shape to my vision to who I have yet to become.  I’m really grateful to have found this!
attributes.title: A True Compass for Life!

attributes.review: I’m so happy to have stumbled across this podcast a couple weeks ago. I’ve since listened to fifteen VALUABLE episodes, each bringing different relevance to my life, being aspects of my parenting, my marriage...anything FAMILY-focused. I love what FRD is doing and can’t wait for Front Row Moms. 😉
attributes.title: I’m a mom and LOVE this podcast

attributes.review: Jon has a powerful ability to hold conversations incredible guests and do it with honesty and humility and grace and curiosity. Every episode is edifying, insightful, and encouraging.
attributes.title: Every dad will love this show!

attributes.review: Thank you for this podcast. Your content and information is super helpful.  Even more than that I am really grateful for and appreciate the value I get from your uncanny ability to break down the complex issues and articulate questions exactly as I wish I could. Your approach and this content allow me to have a significant leg up on the challenges of being a loving spouse and parent from where I would have been without it. Thank you.
attributes.title: I love the way you break it down and get real.

attributes.review: This podcast is RIDICULOUSLY valuable for fathers and husbands looking to take things to the next level.  There’s nothing else out there like it...Jon is doing the world a great service through his work!  Keep it up!!!
attributes.title: Ridiculously Valuable

attributes.review: Gentlemen, this podcast is only part of a community of high-caliber men. The podcast is very well executed. Impressive guests with relevant topics. Jon interviews in a way that is authentic to conversation and allows his guests to share from a place of passion. I look forward to each release because I know Jon has curated a topic and expert that will teach important values and/or skills to help me in my role as a man and father. You won’t regret investing time in listening!!
attributes.title: Content that men of today need

attributes.review: Jon, host of the Front Row Dads podcast, highlights all aspects of fatherhood, business and more in this can’t miss podcast!  The host and expert guests offer insightful advice and information that is helpful to anyone that listens!
attributes.title: Awesome Podcast!!

attributes.review: This podcast is phenomenal, it doesn’t matter where you’re at in your life as a father this show has so many valuable insights on parenting, relationships, and career. I am a stay at home dad, that has been a difficult thing to swallow at times because of how society looks at stay at home dad‘s. The show has shown me how important my role is as a father and a husband and has helped motivate me to continue to improve myself for the benefit of my family and the world.
attributes.title: Wonderful show for husbands and fathers

attributes.review: If you’re a family man with a business,  or a business man with a family - this is for you! Fantastic guests. Great conversations. Actionable insights and aha moments. Love it...
attributes.title: Amazing!

attributes.review: I am a Front Row Dad member and what I love about the organization and the podcasts is that it gives me so many gold nuggets that help me be a better Dad. These nuggets of wisdom from Jon, his guests and other Dads provide wisdom that make it a mountain of gold for your family to thrive. We all get so into the minutia of our daily lives. Connecting to Front Row Dads gives me perspective and a jolt to stay on the right path. The results are magical which I get to see on my kids and wife's faces. Thank you Jon for making this your life's work. You are helping us all. Keep doing it!!! See you at the retreat.
attributes.title: Front Row Dads podcast

attributes.review: I enjoy listening to Jon speak from the stage because of his amazing ability to communicate. This podcast gave me an opportunity to listen to him regularly about something incredibly important to me and that is being an awesome Dad! Jon creates an incredible platform for Dads to learn about themselves, their families and creating the proper future. Thank you Jon for creating something that's helping enhance my life along with the lives of others!
attributes.title: This is a Must Listen for DADS!

attributes.review: Excellent podcast with unreal community to support it.  There is nothing more powerful to change the world or community than strengthening the family.  This podcast strengthens, uplifts, educated and always has new content, AWESOME!
attributes.title: Repel mediocrity

attributes.review: I have known Jon for some years and although love the guy as a person I didn’t start listening to the podcast till recently. I have to say as a podcaster myself, the information that Jon gets out of the guests and the honesty inspires me to be a better father and husband.  This podcast gives so much value in an authentic way that I will be a long time listener.  Thanks Jon for everything you do.
attributes.title: One of the best!

attributes.review:
There are podcasts, and then there’s Front Row Dads.  This podcast has made, and continues to make, a profound impact on my life every single week.  It helps me improve as a fatherpreneuer and speaks to some of the [exact] challenges I face on a daily basis.

From staying grounded to learning new things, I always leave charged and inspired to be a better father.  It also covers topics that I frequently share with my wife as we raise young children together.

If you run a business and father children subscribe immediately.  I promise you will find value here.

THANK YOU Jon + FRD team for what you put out week over week.  I’m extremely grateful to have content and community like this in my life!
attributes.title: My Go-To Week Over Week

attributes.review: As a father who juggles work/family life balance, I love this podcast. It has been so enlightening for me and is extremely enjoyable to listen to.  Thanks for all you guys do!
attributes.title: Best dad podcast

attributes.review: Highly recommend for anyone looking to grow as a father, husband or man. Talking about my feelings and emotions has always been very difficult and this podcast has provided me with different strategies and approaches to improve. It’s part of my daily routine!
attributes.title: Great topics by an approachable host

attributes.review: Such a great interview with Dr. Laura Dabney, and a great insight on how vulnerability is key to moving past a lot of emotional issues.
attributes.title: Wow

attributes.review:
For the last 2 years or so, I’ve been on an absolute mission to become a better man, husband, and father. It is really difficult to find men in my local sphere that are as intent on this journey as I am. I’ve found my tribe, and I don’t have to feel like I’ve gone ‘overboard’ because I won’t settle for mediocrity in my relationships.

This podcast has shown me what greatness can look like through Jon and the incredible insights and experiences from the guests. I have implemented a number of things that I’ve learned, and I’ve seen myself and my family grow. 

I won’t spend my time listening to something if it’s not applicable and actionable. THIS IS! It is an important part of my ‘family university’ that Is an integral part of my family’s life. I can’t thank you enough for helping me to step into my better self.
attributes.title: Listen Up- A Call To Action

attributes.review: What we focus on expands in our worlds. The quality of these interviews, the depth of their authenticity, and the importance of getting the “Dad game” RIGHT...this is priority number one here. Listen and learn my Friends. Thanks Front Row Dads and Jon 🙏🙏❤️👏👏
attributes.title: Truly helping me take my Dad game higher & higher

attributes.review: I started listening to these this year, and got very serious about them and have been listening to one each day.  The Marcus Sheridan episode is a must-listen.  So much great content, and they go by very quickly!
attributes.title: Outstanding content

attributes.review: Just finished the podcast with Sachin Patel and my jaw dropped at how simple and easy it is to make the changes needed to live longer, stronger, and faster!  Thank you Sachin and Jon for sharing this conversation!
attributes.title: Sachin Patel just blew my mind!

attributes.review: This podcast is amazing, I love hearing authentic people sharing their stories - beyond just the hype of social media and what we see from the outside. It’s authentic and raw - consistently above and beyond what I expect. I take away at least one profound insight from each episode.
attributes.title: Jon is a great interviewer

attributes.review: Jon has created an incredible podcast and brotherhood for fathers. I’m looking forward to being more part of this group. Thank you!
attributes.title: Great podcast!!!

attributes.review: As a fan of David’s books - Wealth Can’t Wait and the Miracle Morning for Millionaires, I was intrigued to hear him on a podcast.  He did not disappoint!  He is as genuine and real as I expected.  It is impressive to see such a successful guy talking about his values around parenting and not about his private jet (he actually has one!  And also doesn’t brag about it!). It truly emphasizes where his values truly are!  Yes, it is great to be successful because you can do more good in the world, but it is also important to participate in your life and with your family.  As a MOM (ie, not officially your target audience), I LOVE hearing dads step up as parents.  Thank you for what you do, it matters!!!
attributes.title: David Osborn rocked it

attributes.review: I love that Front Row Dads has created this community and tool to help dads be better parents. As a mom, I’m super passionate about creating a successful family and being the best parent I can be. The podcast with David Osborn has huge takeaways for me especially making small adjustments for massive differences. What I can do as a parent but also small habits with our children that will set them up for success.
attributes.title: Episode with David Osborn is Amazing!

attributes.review: Great episode for Dads and non-Dads alike! I've been following David's work for a couple years now, and this interview provides insight into his motivation and strategic planning when it comes to family that definitely comes out but is not the focus of other more business based podcast interviews. There are golden nuggets throughout the interview, and here are a few that stuck out to me because they made me think harder about my own life: David credits his military upbringing to making him resilient and flexible, but didn't want that lifestyle for his children. I chose, or vowed actually, not to start a family while I was serving in the military because I saw a lot of families that were going through hard times due to all of the uncertainty associated with a military life, and I didn't want that from my family. David's Dad as a hardcore SF officer had a bit of a temper, mine does too... I vowed that I would not treat people that way. David very deliberately chooses the environment he surrounds himself, his wife, and their children with. Living in a neighborhood with great community was more important for him than living in the most luxurious, elite, but likely secluded neighborhood. David's leadership in GoBundance, FamBundance, and Front Row Dads ensure his family is always around the best peer group and going on epic adventures with them. David and Jon both speak about the right balance with having nice things and living a very abundant lifestyle and not "spoiling" the kids. By keeping the focus on gratitude and creating an understanding for them that most of the world does not live like we do is critical. Knowing how to work hard is key, and understanding the power of leverage and focusing on thinking and solving big problems will allow those  children to be the best at whatever they choose to do and positively impact the world. The discussion about fully embracing the role of being a the patriarch, regardless of if your Dad is around or not is still around or not, is key.  Dads want to know that their kids are successful leaders, and getting to show my Dad that is a priority of mine. Again, great interview! Must listen for Dads and for those aspiring to have a family someday!
attributes.title: Episode #62 with David Osborn

attributes.review: Just listened to the podcast with David Osborn, someone I have long admired. Listening to the transformation and focus he puts on being present and active while still crushing his businesses. A great podcast for anyone that has ever struggled with that
attributes.title: The desire to balance and excel at both

attributes.review:
I first heard John Vroman @BYEB 17 in San Diego and he is a very engaging speaker so I was looking forward to listening to his interview with David Osborn whom I also heard speak at the same event and have read two of his books, “Wealth Can’t Wait” and “The Miracle Morning for Millionaires.” 

As a wife, mother, and entrepreneur, I thought I could gain some insight for family ideas and I was not disappointed. I appreciate David’s transparency about his childhood and his family. I love the idea of telling a story from your own childhood when reading to your children. What a great way to create curiosity and lead to more questions about your life as well as introspection for yourself. Win-win. 

Motivational speaker Jim Rohn has said that we are the average of the five people we spend the most time with. David echoes that when he says, “You have to be around the right kind of people to become the right kind of person. There’s just no other way. People say you change from the inside out. I think you change from the outside in.”

I also value Kindness as a trait the world needs and liked hearing that’s important to David to instill in his children. I enjoyed David’s interview and insight along with Jon’s and appreciate them sharing a glimpse into their personal lives. Finding balance between work and home is difficult for entrepreneurs as our passion for work blurs the boundaries of home life. 

I highly recommend you listen to the podcast yourself to glean all the gold nuggets these two accomplished men share. Well done.
attributes.title: Jon and David are true examples of Family Men with a Business.

attributes.review: Jon has a way of speaking with people that allows him to make sure the best and most practical tips and ideas come to the surface of the conversation.  This podcast is a staple on my car playlist and I constantly find myself going back and listening to highlights later to take notes or to write down a book recommendation mentioned on the show.  Love the variety of guests.
attributes.title: Practical, Relatable, and Inspiring

attributes.review: Powerful series from leaders FOR leaders. Every word allows for lessons and teachings to bring back to your family. Build a habit of listening to this podcast and you’ll build a habit of successful parenting in your household.
attributes.title: Powerful

attributes.review:
“What do you do?”
That’s a pretty standard question at a dinner party. 
And a standard answer would be “I am a businessman who does x, y and z. And I also have a family.”
Until one day, Jon Vroman, co-founder of the Front Row Foundation, decided to make a small distinction. 
He was a family man with a business rather than a business man with a family. 
From that small distinction, a movement was begun. 
On this podcast, Vroman explores what it is to be an outstanding father and husband  first, and then bringing that better version of the yourself to your business. 
Jon does a great job of exploring the topic with a wealth of guests from all walks of life exploring topics like travel, educational, sexually, relationships skills and much more.
